notesStmt.note: Later addition on the lower margin of folio 59v. חזק at the end of Chronicles, folio 206v.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Prophets and Hagiographa, punctuated, accompanied with masorah magna and parva.

collation.p: 29 quires of mostly 8 leaves. Quires marked with catchwords on the last page.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Square Ashkenazi script of the 13th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Bible. Hebrew. Vol. 2. Brit. Mus. Additional 9402.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Adam Clarke (b. 1762, d. 1832), Wesleyan Methodist minister and scholar: his inscription in Latin (folio 1r); manuscript acquired by him at Utrecht in 1823. His bookplate with Greek inscription: ho theos agape estin (folio [i verso]). This codex, together with nine other manuscripts (Add MS 9398-9407), was acquired by the British Museum in 1834, once the property of the Hagen family and then bought by Adam Clarke.
